posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Heya, folks!

I have been without internet for the last couple of days, which has given me some time to work on a very cool concept build (but nonetheless optimized) of a Dwarven Paladin hero. Obviously, he is supposed to be a paladin, but since he is a dwarf, he also needs to represent dwarvishness by not giving a $%&¨about social standards. That will be represented by his total lack of Charisma (score of 6), which essentially makes him a fear-immune, self-buffing fighter for hack'n'slash purposes. Fighter comes in with the combat feats, Palading throws in the immunity to fear and the buffs and Rogue compliments the package nicely with Tumble and UMD. I have found that this toon will actually have a buffed AB equal to that of a Fighter 12 Weapon Master 25 Rogue 3 build on WoG. While the latter ends up with 65 AB, this one will have 66 fully buffed AB, and that's no small feat. As if that weren't enough, he can Taunt some opponents just in case, but with 6 CHA, forget about Taunting casters and high-concentration mobs.

posts.author: MrZork
posts.content:
Interesting build. I like the RP angle of the unsociable dwarf with lots of taunt. Too bad about the XP penalty, though.

I am curious about the order of epic combat feats. Is there a reason to grab the crit feats before EWF and EWS, especially in PvM? Not that I see a problem with it, and this may be a general question about the order people prefer for those feats. I guess I play in modules where there are so many crit-immune foes (especially bosses) that I am used to going for the feats that are a benefit against everyone before the others where a common immunity may apply.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
MrZork wrote:Interesting build. I like the RP angle of the unsociable dwarf with lots of taunt. Too bad about the XP penalty, though.

I am curious about the order of epic combat feats. Is there a reason to grab the crit feats before EWF and EWS, especially in PvM? Not that I see a problem with it, and this may be a general question about the order people prefer for those feats. I guess I play in modules where there are so many crit-immune foes (especially bosses) that I am used to going for the feats that are a benefit against everyone before the others where a common immunity may apply.
Basically the reason is that you don't really need AB, cuz you have all your buffs and you don't need damage cuz, well, you have all your buffs, but they are sort of a limited source of uberness, while Devastating Critical will basically save you a lot of time and work with many foes. Where I play, the sooner you get the feat the better. Yes, the toughest lvl 40 bosses and some other 30+ CR ones are crit-immune, so if you delay devcrit too much it will sort of be less effective. However, it's an environment-dependant choice, so if you face many of those crit-immunes, maybe you can switch them up or even drop them altogether, the question then would have to be, what would you pick in their place? Anyway, it is designed for the environment I know, and there it'll thrive as is. Tweak to taste, brother

Take it EZ!
